title: Modern Gaspipe examples
content:
In the [blurb for Tungsten](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011222658/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100035) H&FJ describe the style as a "Modern Gaspipe". I particularly like this style, with strong vertical lines, an explicit diagonal in the S and corners like a race track at the top and bottom.

Googling Modern Gaspipe doesn't yield much besides Tungsten. Does anyone know of some other good examples of this style, preferably with a lighter weight, such as [Bourgeois](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011222658/http:/www.virusfonts.com/fonts/bourgeois#characters-42)?

Many thanks,  
Stephen
author: ffub

comments.content: Thanks very much, all good examples. I went with Block Gothic in the end.
